page.title: 13Balloon Wood Flats.
page.content: The Â£3m Balloon Wood access flat development was part of a national response to the problems of slum- clearance and re-housing.Its philosophical justification was 'terraced streets in the sky',but its actual function was closer to mass resettlement on the cheap.Within a month,the first tenants were complaining of walls with mould and over the next 15 years damp became an increasing problem as the concrete sweated from within and corroded the steel reinforcing from outside.Inevitably,as the monolithic ediface deteriorated,it became highly unattractive to potential tenants and developed into a dumping ground for people whose problems were compounded by such an environment.In 1984 permission was granted for demolition.
